data.title: Adding the Rocks to Tiberian Sun
data.body: This PR adds the Rocks to Tiberian Sun. This can be tested with the ingame map editor :)

data.title: Possibility to play as random/any faction within a certain side (allied/soviet)
data.body:
Let's say a player wants to play with soviet side because he likes a certain unit, but still wishes some randomness within soviet factions.

Should there be an option for "Any allied" and "Any soviet" in addition to "Any" faction when setting up a game? I think so.

And please don't use this as a point of why issue #7391 should not be implemented :)

data.title: (Abandoned idea) Suggestions for the mission Intervention
data.body:
In the Intervention mission it would be better if the air-striking of the civilian village started after you place your MCV on the main island.

Maybe there should be some more play after the air force command is captured, like use the soviet aircrafts.

data.title: Nod Mission 2a
data.body:
This is the first Nod Mission from this closed PR https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7387
I think I implemented all changes according to your comments.

I think I should explain how we worked to create this maps. We gone through all ini files of the original C&C maps and try to implement all triggers with lua. We used this site to understand what every trigger does: https://searchcode.com/codesearch/view/78104/.
I think not everything in this guide is correct.

So all lua function are named after the trigger of the original ini file.

There is still no real AI, but I implement the production trigger according to guide above and I think the behaviour of the units in this map is similar to the original one.

data.title: Disable the diplomacy menu in mission or campaign maps
data.body:
Before:
![diplomacy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/5925578/c67d8536-a664-11e4-96ff-7b49e368d5f7.png)

Maybe we should expose that to map.yaml (not to the lobby).

data.title: In-game menus should not reveal factions of enemies who chose "any" faction.
data.body:
The game menus (preferences, diplomacy) instantly reveal factions of enemy players (or AI) who chose "any" as their faction. 

I feel this should be changed since choosing "any" (random) should give the player the advantage of surprise. It also balances out the fact that they can't plan ahead (the details - which with factions implemented will hopefully become more important) before the game starts. 
I feel this would give players another strategic option.
It would also make scouting more important.

I think that at least some other popular RTS games already have this mechanic (Starcraft?).

I'm not saying that menus should get updated with faction information once the player has been scouted/their units spotted, just leave it at "Any" / "???" / "random". If it's doable it wouldn't hurt of course.

Showing factions of your allies should be left as is (shown).
What do you think?

data.title: TD: Track "Act on Instinct (Voiced)" does not play
data.body:
playtest: 20150118 / win32

clicking on "Act on Instinct (Voiced)" jumps right to the next track in the list without playing the track.
happens to me on two installs of the playtest on two separate machines, all other tracks play
I think this was broken for me already in the last release

OpenRA downloaded the music files from openra-mirror.ihptru.net on this machine, not sure where the files came from on the other machine

edit: scores.mix has CRC32: A3A2DDA1

data.title: TD "Install Game Content" dialog incorrectly states music cannot be downloaded
data.body:
playtest: 20150118 / win32

TD "Install Game Content" dialog incorrectly states music cannot be downloaded but has to be installed from original media when it has been possible to download it easily from within openra for some time now

edit: I realized after submitting that the text means that music will not be downloaded using this dialog, however it may be worthwhile to point out the music can be easily downloaded later

![tdmusic](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10729559/5924323/16acd70a-a65b-11e4-93e9-f78509a2ecc0.png)

data.title: D2K - Carryall moved to last in Starport.
data.body: Carryall was between trike and quad in Starport and looks a bit odd. It should be in last like orginal Starport.

data.title: NOD Campaign maps (1 - 8)
data.body:
This is an implementation of NOD Campaign maps.

Maps 1 and 3 fixed and updated. Maps 2, 4 - 8 created from scratch.

Some triggers were not implemented, because there is no native implementation in OpenRA project for them.
Link for trigger-implementation details: https://scm.thm.de/redmine/projects/dtdj-ultj/wiki
This WiKi page is on german. If you need a translation, please write an email to: alexander.boll@mni.thm.de

data.title: Is the NuGet requirement justified?
data.body:
In Gentoo, =games-strategy/openra-20150118 requires dev-dotnet/nuget
What is this new addition which justifies having your users install a new package manager (!) which is not in portage, and how does one build without it?
The ebuild should have a USE flag to disable the requirement for NuGet.

data.title: Changed the chat notification sounds for RA mod
data.body: The current sound "BEDOOP" is kind've obnoxious right? The other mods get nice chat sounds now so how about these?

data.title: Added the new modular build palette to Dune 2000
data.body:
Fixes #3699
Closes #6043

data.title: Fix wrong log channel name: Debug -> debug
data.body: Fixes #7379

data.title: Added support for StyleCop+
data.body: I disabled most of the rules for now just because we violate it so often especially CheckAllowedIndentationCharacters which checks for spaces instead of tabs, but is my next priority.

data.title: Classic left-click orders
data.body: Left click to select units and issue orders. This also needs to catch miss-clicks that result from this setup.

data.title: Fixed redundant/ambiguous dispatch methods
data.body:
#### Purpose

Step 1 of 4~ towards unified networking protocol that will simplify networking and drastically improve bandwidth. As it stands the server dispatch consists of multiple ambiguous methods with no clear data path.
#### Review

Easy to test, just play the game. Abnormal behavior compared to upstream/bleed is a bug.
Didn't find any problems? Please give a thumbs up; thank you for your time!

data.title: Invalid log channel crash when skipping an invalid map.
data.body: MapCache.cs:L64ish: The "Debug" channel is bogus (should be "debug").

data.title: Switch wiki deployment to the orabot user with SSH auth
data.body:
I'm not really sure if this is enough to fix the deployment, since IIRC the "Updating https://github.com/..." line didn't appear in the travis build log, so the script must have either not run at all or bailed out before even doing anything git-related. Anyhow, that's why I added another echo at the start of the script to see what's going on.

Once this is merged, this repo needs to use orabot's creds for the travis-ci service.

data.title: D2K: Units shouldn't follow sandworms once the 'Stop' command is issued
data.body:
For the time being, units keep following and attacking sandworms even if the 'Stop' command is issued. They actually do stop following a particular sandworm, but the effect of the 'Stop' command only lasts until the next occasion, when a new sandworm enters their view. The undesired effect of this is sandworms deforming defensive lines, which are formed having enemy units in mind.

As I see it, it should be possible to make units attack sandworms while standing their ground. So that the sandworms would still get attacked and yet it would not lead to the fragmentation of defensive lines.

data.title: Fix ts prerequisistes
data.body:
As wished by @Phrohdoh . :)

Removed the `Owner:` trait and added `Prerequisistes:`.

data.title: Add more fake buildings
data.body: Improves the usefulness of the vanilla Allies country by adding high tech fake structures. At some stage I'll also let spies infiltrate fake buildings which have an infiltratable counterpart building.

data.title: Map preview/zoom option in the game lobby
data.body:
In the game lobby it would be helpful (for strategic planning) to be able to see a higher resolution preview of the map especially when you're not familiar with it. The larger preview would also help with additional icon placement described in issue  #3359.

A click on the current map thumbnail would bring up a lager preview, another click (anywhere) or the Esc key would close it.

What do you think? 

Something like this:
![openra_lobby_map](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/5852543/e2f11be2-a218-11e4-963a-de8d9459079b.png)

![openra_lobby_map_preview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/5852544/e7f87d7e-a218-11e4-81e1-8f85bbd2e289.png)
